utterance.content: This kitty is Mittens and this one is Fitzhugh, and this little guy in the cat condo is Jinkies.

utterance.content: Tell him that you haven't seen your wife in a long time. Tell him that having a long-distance relationship is really difficult. Tell him that what little time we have is precious.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, ah, ah.. . I'll think of something.

utterance.content: Wow! Wow, you look.. . uh.. . It's just, ah.. . That dress.. . uh.. .

utterance.content: Oh well, well thank you. Okay, stop. Stop looking at me like that. The last time that happened, that happened.

utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Phoebe and I are going to have so much fun. And thank you for watching the baby, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh that's so cute: Ross and Mike's first date. Is that going to be awkward? I mean, what are you guys going to talk about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know. But, you know, we, we have a lot in common, you know. He plays piano; I played keyboards in college. He's been divorced; I have some experience in that area.

utterance.content: Hi

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.content: Okay. You too. And I hope you score. Bye.

utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.content: So.. . Welcome.

utterance.content: Okay. So, um, Phoebe tells me you, ah, you play piano.

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: Ah? Do you have one here?

utterance.content: No.

utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.content: Um.. . ah.. . you know, I'm divorced. Um, Phoebe, ah.. . Phoebe said you.. . You've been divorced?

utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I'm sorry. I don't.. . I don't really like to talk about it.

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: My cousin's a paleontologist.

utterance.content: Well, it looks great. It's just that.. . well, I'm wearing the same thing underneath. So.. .

utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.content: See what I mean.. .

utterance.content: NO!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! Wait!

utterance.content: I heard him again!

utterance.content: Okay. Great. I'll see you when you get here. I'm gonna wait out in the hall in case the dude comes out.

utterance.content: Is that really necessary?

utterance.content: Absolutely. You'd do it for me. Not that you ever have to because I know how to keep my women satisfied.

utterance.content: I know. So, what's going on with you and Ross?

utterance.content: Well, um.. . I don't know. I mean, for a long time nothing. But you know, actually right before you picked me up, Ross and I had a.. . ah.. . little thing.

utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.content: No! Wait! No, no. Don't do that! That's going to make them think they can come over here.

utterance.content: So? What if they do?

utterance.content: Well, we're not here to meet guys. You have a boyfriend, I have a b.. . baby and a Ross.

utterance.content: Chandler, you have to tell Joey that you're not in Tulsa.

utterance.content: Don't you think it's better for him to think that you're cheating on me, than for him to think that I'm cheating on him? I heard it.

utterance.content: I don't want him to think that I'm having an affair.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right. I've got a plan. I'll go down the fire escape.

utterance.content: Hear me out woman. I'll go down the fire escape. Then, I'll wait for a while. Then, when I come up the stairs, it'll be just like I just got back from Tulsa. Then, Joey and I will come in and see that there's no guy in here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aren't you afraid that Joey's going to figure all of this out? I heard it.

utterance.content: I'm just going to wait for a little while.

utterance.content: Oh my God. I can't believe you live in that building. My grandmother lives in that building. Ida Green? No sense of personal space? Kind of smells like chicken? Looks like a potato.

utterance.content: No. No, because I know exactly how the conversation's gonna go. "Hey Ross, you know, I think we had a moment before. "

utterance.content: Well, the point is, maybe I should just stop waiting around for moments with Ross, you know? I should just.. . move on with my life.

utterance.content: I don't know. Do I have to decide right now?

utterance.content: Oh God, Ross. Ross is going to pick up the phone. Oh, I have to get my number back. Oh my God. He's gone.

utterance.content: Oh give me , , , Hi, Mike? Hi. Listen. I know this is a lot to ask, but you know what? If you do this I.. . Phoebe will.. . do anything you want. Seriously, I'm talking dirty stuff.

utterance.content: Wow! That didn't take long. I thought you said Tulsa was, like a three hour flight.

utterance.content: That's right. You're husband's home. So, now the sex can stop.

utterance.content: I can't believe you thought I was cheating. You own me an apology.

utterance.content: Joey?
